page.title: 03Trusham Village -2-
page.content: There is no industry as such in the village, but many villagers work in the local quarry and precast concrete works. Others commute to Exeter, Chudleigh, and Newton Abbot daily. Some new private houses have recently been built and these vary in price from forty to eighty thousand pounds with no natural gas service. Many sporting and social activities are linked to other villages in the Teign Valley. For example Trusham supported the fund raising for the resurfacing of the tennis courts at Christow. A mobile library visits the village once a week, and a mobile playgroup visits during the summer. For young people there is little social life, and they therefore tend to go to Chudleigh, Torquay or Exeter for entertainment. There is a bus to Newton Abbot every Wednesday at 10am.(Don't miss it!).
